page.title: 11WATERMANS ARTS CENTRE
page.content:
Watermans Arts Centre, opened in 1984, was in planning for 15 years. It took about three years to build and cost about Â£2m. It is open every day, from 10am till 11pm. About three thousand people visit it each week. It includes a{theatre}and a{cinema.}Two popular films recently shown were: Private Function, for adults, and BMX Bandits, for children. There are regular{art {exhibitions,}a recent example being Soviet War Artists.
Lunches, teas and suppers are served in the{restaurant}and there is a{bar. The Centre is in{Brentford High Street on the north side of the Thames, just west of{Kew Bridge.}There is, however, no danger of flooding, either of the building or of the pleasant landscaped garden.
